intro: Hieracium eperythrum, commonly known as the lesser hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and serrated leaves. Its flowers are yellow or orange, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, and it blooms from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium eperythrum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
